question:
Some of the famous seaports were frequently making headlines due to their strategic and economic importance. In this context, consider the following seaports with countries where they are located:
  1. Trincomalee - Maldives
  2. Bandar Abbas- Iraq
  3. Port of Duqm- Oman
Which of the above is/are correct?
explanation: Recently, India has finalised an agreement with Oman which will allow India to gain access to the strategically located port of Duqm, on Oman’s southern coast. The port of Duqm, lies on the north-western edge of Indian Ocean and also provides easy access onward into the Red Sea through the Gulf of Aden. Government of Sri Lanka recently announced that very soon will be signing a MoU with India to jointly develop the Trincomalee port in the north-eastern part of the country. Bandar Abbas is a port in Iran. It forms an important part of the International North South Transport Corridor (INSTC) project. Under the proposed project, Indian Government aims to move cargoes from Jawaharlal Nehru and Kandla ports on India’s west coast to Bandar Abbas (Iran) by sea.
